fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
We are trying to create a knowledge base following http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Creating+Your+Knowledge+Base+Space, therefore we request that the Support Tools plugin be installed in our Jira Studio instance. (AOD-21906)

We received the following reply:

"Per our [﻿Plugin Policy|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/JIRA+Studio+Plugin+Policy], we offer a specific set of bundled plugins with JIRA Studio (a list of which is at the above link).

If you would like to see the support tool plugin added in the future, you can submit a feature request at https://studio.atlassian.com as we are looking to include many more plugins in future releases."

Which is the reason I´m opening this request. We would really appreciate this will be taken into consideration.

Thank you,

Izmet Barranco
fields.summary: Support Tools plugin added

fields.description:
It causes an error on line 251, char 222

Workaround is to download the attachments manually through the downloads page.
Another workaround is to attach the image full-size, rather than as a thumbnail.

fields.description:
When I receive an email with the update info the fix version of the issue is wrong.

Example:

 Fix Version/s:     (was: 1.2.70)
                   1.2.69

It should be:

 Fix Version/s:   1.2.70  (was: 1.2.69)

'admin' is not added to 'balsamiq-mockups-editors' group in GAPPS mode

fields.description:
There is a studio upgrade task that adds existing users (active or not) to the 'balsamiq-mockups-editors' group. 
When running in gapps mode, there could be many users who have no access to Studio and are added to this group, if the new customer has a large user base in their Google domain.
fields.summary: Inactive users are added to balsamiq-mockups-editors group

fields.description: When you are not logged into JIRA studio and you go to an issue page, the Log In button is in white, rather than the color selected by the user. For users with white headers, this causes the button to disappear entirely.
fields.summary: JIRA Studio uses wrong color for Log In button when viewing an issue

fields.description:
After performing a comparison of the General/Issues admin tabs in June and comparing them to the latest on the JIRA 4.4 integration branch, there's a few admin items that seem to have gone missing. All of these have no links in the admin menu but are accessible by hitting the URLs directly.

||Title||Access||URL||Where it should be||
| Jelly Runner | Sysadmin | /secure/admin/util/JellyRunner!default.jspa | Advanced |
| Send E-mail | Admin/Sysadmin | /secure/admin/jira/SendBulkMail!default.jspa | Mail |
| Announcement Banner | Admin/Sysadmin | /secure/admin/EditAnnouncementBanner!default.jspa | User Interface |
| Remember My Login | Admin/Sysadmin (inaccessible to Admins at the moment) | /secure/admin/user/AllUsersRememberMeCookies!default.jspa | Security |
| CVS Modules | Sysadmin | /secure/admin/ViewRepositories.jspa | Advanced? |

Some plugin admin items are also missing from the admin menu, even though the plugins are running. Again, the pages are accessible if you visit the URLs directly.

||Plugin||Title||Access||URL||
| Gliffy | Gliffy Plugin for JIRA License | Admin/Sysadmin | /secure/admin/GliffyLicenseAction.jspa | 
| BitBucket Connector | Bitbucket | Admin/Sysadmin | /secure/admin/ConfigureBitbucketRepositories!default.jspa |
| GitHub Connector | OAuth Settings | Admin/Sysadmin | /secure/admin/ConfigureGlobalSettings!default.jspa |
| GitHub Connector | Bulk Configure Repositories | Admin/Sysadmin | /secure/admin/GitHubConfigureRepositories!default.jspa |
fields.summary: JIRA admin menu items are missing from the Studio admin section in July release

fields.description: See Attached.
fields.summary: Gapps activity bar notifications are hidden behind GH cards

fields.description:
In the June release, the "User Sessions" admin page was visible to both admins and sysadmins, but the link to it was not visible to admins. 
In July, the link is now admin-visible.

This page shows information about the current HTTP sessions of all users, including their internal session ID (not JSESSIONID). It doesn't seem to show anything exploitable.

!UserSessions.png!

Is this intentional or was this page never meant to be accessible to admins?
fields.summary: "User Sessions" admin item is now visible to administrators

fields.description: When the wiki space uses a space key that differs from the project key, the tabs links are generated incorrectly.
fields.summary: Tabs use incorrect links when WIKI space uses different key

fields.description:
In Studio admin, on the General tab, if you click "Look and Feel", it takes you to the Look and Feel admin page, but sets the active tab to "Issues" and opens the current heading to "User Interface".

This bug is new in the July release.
fields.summary: Studio Look-and-Feel admin page opens the wrong admin section heading

fields.description:
There seems to be now way to edit the color of the link "LogIn" on the right corner if user is not logged in. I changed the background color of my header to white, so the link is invisible (white text on white background cannot be read that good :) ). I searched a way to change the link color in the Admin/Look & feel menü. Although there is not a single entry left that is set to #ffffff, the link still is invisible.
So I think there should be one more entry in the menu that allows to change the color of this link (file navbar.css, line 86 #studio-user-menu-container .login-link { color: #FFFFFF; )
fields.summary: Look & Feel - color of Log In link cannot be changed

fields.description:
"General Configuration" is right at the bottom of the list in the Issues admin in Studio, under a lot of far more obscure settings.
!IssuesAdmin.png!

In JIRA 4.4 standalone, it's the first entry in the System block.
!GeneralConfigJIRA44.png!
fields.summary: JIRA's General Configuration is right at the bottom of the Issues admin

fields.description:
We have multiple "Workflows" headings in different places with different content under them. It is quite confusing.

!Workflows2.png!

!Workflows1.png!

Opening this for tracking purposes, but we already have a meeting with the PMs planned to discuss it.
fields.summary: With Ignite, there are duplicate headings under the General and Issues admin tabs and the content is split between them

fields.description:
This can help us limit transient memory usage in FishEye and resulting OOMEs

See https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FECRU-1174 for details
fields.summary: Set q.sequence.memory-threshold to 10M in FishEye

fields.description:
After the introduction of project Ignite, there's a lot more functionality in the main Project Admin page. In Studio, general project administration is done using the JIRA project admin page. Unfortunately, this now means that there's a lot of JIRA-specific concepts appearing under the "General" administration tab and not the "Issues" tab.

In previous versions, these were linked from the Project Admin page but not located directly in this section. 

!JIRAInGeneral.png!

Opening this for tracking purposes, but we already have a meeting with the PMs planned to discuss it.
fields.summary: With Ignite, JIRA-specific content is mixed into the General admin tab of Studio

fields.description:
Customers are affected by a NullPointerException bug that currently exists in the bundled version of Tempo (6.2.2).

Upgrade Tempo to 6.2.3 or higher to fix.
fields.summary: NullPointerException in Tempo

fields.description:
When attempting to load a Studio page while an instance is nonresponsive, a "Website is down" page is displayed (electro-Charlie). This page doesn't seem to have any headers or meta tags to indicate that it should not be cached.

{noformat}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx
Date: Fri, 01 Jul 2011 02:59:53 GMT
Content-Type: text/html
Content-Length: 1385
Last-Modified: Wed, 04 May 2011 07:31:18 GMT
Connection: keep-alive
Accept-Ranges: bytes

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01//EN"
   "http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/strict.dtd">

<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xml:lang="en" lang="en">
<head>
	<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=utf-8">
{noformat}

Later, when the instance comes back up, hitting the same URL gives the locally cached version of the file, making it appear that the instance is still down. Only if you manually refresh, does it hit the instance again.
fields.summary: "Website Down" page is cached in the browser

fields.description:
I provisioned several Gapps UC-1 instances. They periodically give me the Charlie picture when being accessed from browser (shouldn't be due to browser cache), and at the same time become unreachable by ping and SSH. The problem just goes away after a few minutes and re-appear again, and the cycle will repeat.

One example is this container: {{studio-qa-gapps-3.jira.com}}
fields.summary: Gapps UC-1 instances not accessible periodically

fields.description: Please see https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AOD-5252 and http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Plugin+Developer+Notes+for+JIRA+4.4#PluginDeveloperNotesforJIRA4.4-PluggableProjectOperation for details.
fields.summary: Update bundled plugins to match new project config screen markup

fields.description:
Gapps instances were provisioned through staging MAC ({{https://intsys-staging.atlassian.com/my/googleAuth/domain}}). The following error was seen on the Google User Management admin page:
{noformat}
21:44:40: INFO: User synchronization process started...
21:44:40: INFO: Querying Google for all users
21:44:41: ERROR: Synchronization aborted due to an unexpected exception
{noformat}
No Google user was synchronized to Studio, and the Google bar is not working either. (When clicking the Gmail button, the pop-up menu wasn't expanded. Instead, we were led to gmail directly. This is the same observation we have got on {{sdog}} in its early days.)
fields.summary: Google integration not working on production UC-1 instances

Remove logout overrides

*Actual:* A message saying 'No Google User found in session'

A better error message / auto-retry would be nice.

fields.description:
The documentation of [Configuring Issue Linking|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Issue+Linking] mentions that _New installations of JIRA come with four default types of links_ and *Issue linking is enabled by default*.
However on Studio this feature is not enabled by default and while you turn Issue Linking on it doesn't come up with any default link types. (See attached screenshots)

fields.description:
- Login as admin
- Create a new user with developer role
- Create a project
- Click on the "Wiki" tab.
- Create a page
- Click on tools -> Page restrictions
- Type the new user's name in the textbox

*Expected*: Username to appear in the dropdown

*Actual*: No matches.

Note:
- This reproes for any page where user look up is present. For example, the Manage Watchers page.
- The people directory page is also missing the user, although I am not sure if the expectation is that it would appear here or not.

fields.description:
http://screencast.com/t/fdD0YmZ0ur

- Create a project with 1 version
- Add an issue to the project assigned to the new version
- Create a dashboard
- Add "GreenHopper Task Board" gadget.
- Configure to display "Todo" items for the new project
- Click save

*Expected*: Card for the issue to display

*Actual*: Infinite progress bar appears and never goes away. Browser reports JS errors on AUI:
{code}

Line: 230

Code: 0
URI: https://googledev.jira.com/s/617/432/3.3.1/_/download/batch/com.atlassian.auiplugin:ajs/com.atlassian.auiplugin:ajs.js

- After the gadget is added and I refresh the browser, the card renderes correctly. However, whenever the gadget goes to edit mode and Saved, this same error occurs.

Since JIRA has been upgraded to 4.3, we have a Logout Confirmation page when the user selects "Logout" from the user menu. For a gapps instance, this page is not available. Non-gapps instance still has this confirmation page upon logging out.

fields.description:
Following the JIRA Admin Mode I would like to roll this across to Studio. I have made a "proof of concept" here: https://studio.atlassian.com/wiki/display/~sthebridge/Studio+Admin+Mode

This maps our exact Admin menus across without any structural changes, but I plan to sit down with Tim to go through each sub menu to establish a more organised and obvious structure.

fields.description:
This only happens on Unicorn. (The same steps on Zeus lead to a different issue AOD-5157).
# Login to Studio.
# Visit a wiki page and bookmark it.
# Close the browser and re-open it again.
# Try to visit the bookmarked page. We will be led to the Confluence login page instead of the Studio login page.
# After logging in via the Confluence login page, we are able to access the wiki page and other parts of Studio properly.

!Confluence-login.png!
fields.summary: Unicorn only: accessing bookmarked wiki page leads to Confluence login page

fields.description:
This page: [How can I migrate my content to and from other Atlassian applications?|http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=181538580] links to a password-protected CAC page, which isn't helpful. 

Also note that the current FAQ includes migrating from a JIRA Studio trial, which doesn't come up much. We encourage customers to select a domain for their trial that they will keep afterwards.

Here is some information we provide if people ask us via email to sales@atlassian.com (feel free to let us know if you have suggestions!):

From installed: [Importing Data|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/Importing+Data]

########From JIRA/Confluence Hosted############

JIRA Hosted and JIRA Studio are separate systems, so you will need to migrate rather than upgrade. Once you've begun your free trial month of JIRA Studio ([try now|https://my.atlassian.com/hosted/signup/studio/] or [try with Google Apps integration|http://www.google.com/enterprise/marketplace/viewListing?productListingId=3421+6389312883797462351]), you can [file a support ticket|http://support.atlassian.com] to have our support engineers migrate your data. Please note that they are booking import times a few weeks out. You can cancel your JIRA Hosted subscription through your [my.atlassian.com|http://my.atlassian.com] account after the migration is complete.


**Restore Data from JIRA Studio to your self-hosted installations**

We can provide you with [Data Backups|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/Data+Backups] that you can then restore into your freshly installed local instance. Please be sure to [file a support ticket|http://support.atlassian.com] to request your backup _before_ your account expires. 
 
The support engineers will provide you with the information you'll need to restore your data etc, but here's a taste:

* [JIRA: Restore your Data|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA043/Restoring+Data]
* [Confluence: Restore your Data|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Site+Backup+and+Restore]
fields.summary: Update FAQ: migrating content has old info/'broken' link

fields.description: Since you might need to change the link color (e.g. in order to make it more visible in some browsers) it is not good that it is only possible to do so for the Jira and Confluence part. It should be possible to change the link color for all arts of Jira Studio.
fields.summary: Change link colors for all parts of Jira Studio

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/43318
fields.summary: Bundle plugin JJUPIN with JIRA studio

fields.description:
When customizing Studio logo and favicon based on an external URL, the feature behaves quite strangely.
# Provided a URL that points to a GIF image such as {{http://www.realstorygroup.com/uploadedimages/Vendor_logo_image_1212786479.gif}}. After clicking the update button, Studio logo changed to the JIRA logo instead of the one from the URL, and exceptions ([^exception-1.txt]) were thrown to the JIRA log. . Here is the screen shot: [^logo-1.png] 
# The same operations as above, but with a different URL which still points to a GIF image, such as {{http://www.google.com.au/intl/en_ALL/images/logos/images_logo_lg.gif}}. The logo still changed to JIRA logo instead of the designated one, but different exceptions were seen in the JIRA log ([^exception-2.txt]).
# With the same URL as above, just repeat the operations a couple of times, the exceptions will be gone, and the selected image shows up correctly as Studio logo.
# With a different URL which points to JPEG image such as this one {{http://www.howtomakemoneyfast.com.au/images/hundred-dollar-notes.jpg}}, the Studio logo changed to the selected image and no exceptions were found in the JIRA log, but the logo only shows a slice of the selected image at the top right corner with the rest area filled with grey colour. Here is the screen shot: [^logo-2.png]
fields.summary: Failed to customize logo from external URL
